meanings.definition: The amount by which something, especially a sum of money, is too small.
meanings.sent1: The family's budget had deficits, so they had to cut back on expenses.
meanings.sent2: The company faced deficits in their revenue due to the economic downturn.
meanings.sent3: Despite his deficits in savings, Tom always found a way to enjoy life.
meanings.sent4: Her deficits in understanding the topic made studying for the exam challenging.
meanings.sent5: The deficits in the charity's donations meant they couldn't help as many people in need.

meanings.sent1: The deficits of food in the pantry made it hard to prepare a meal.
meanings.sent2: The deficits of volunteers affected the success of the event.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had deficits of snacks, but everyone still had a great time.
meanings.sent4: His deficits of patience were evident when he lost his temper quickly.
meanings.sent5: The deficits of sunlight in the room made it feel gloomy and dark.
